definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)

sentences.english: A ship whistles as it enters the harbor… Is the sound coming from the harbor or from the stereophonic speakers inside the cinema?
sentences.chinese: 大船入港的鸣笛声响起，是电影院外港边的声响？

sentences.english: SL 357 was firing by burning wood.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车357号以木材为燃料升火鸣笛。

sentences.english: While all the automobiles, trains, and ships in China were sounding their air sirens .
sentences.chinese: 全中国的火车汽车汽轮停驶鸣笛致哀。

sentences.english: I heard the whistle blow(ing) a few minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟前我听见鸣笛声。

sentences.english: Car horns blare far more blatantly in Shanghai than they ever do in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在上海，汽车鸣笛声比香港吵闹得多。

sentences.english: She heard the distant cry of a locomotive horn.
sentences.chinese: 她听到远处火车的鸣笛声。

sentences.english: Why does a train whistle bring on a feeling of nostalgia?
sentences.chinese: 为何火车鸣笛声会带来怀旧感？

sentences.english: Can you hear the train whistle?
sentences.chinese: 你能听到火车的鸣笛声吗？

sentences.english: One can whistle down the brakes when something happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生什么事情的时候可以鸣笛通知制动工。

sentences.english: Far away in the distance, a train whistled.
No honking or construction work within a hundred metres of a testing site—by local ordinance.
sentences.chinese: 当地条例规定，不准在考点100米内鸣笛或施工。

sentences.english: We spoke a ship with the whistle.
sentences.chinese: 我们鸣笛与过往船打招呼。

definition: pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
